result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Sue Heebink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa Sue Heebink is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa Sue Heebink was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Noah C.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Participate and successfully complete MRT.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent and follow all recommendations.

03:13 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Melissa Sue Heebink appeared. Includes: Sentencing: 15CF514 and STC: 18CF263, 18CF296, 18CF329, 18CF392. ADA Minser gives sentencing argument regarding the amended count 2 in 15CF514. Atty Chapman gives argument. DEF's mother addresses Court. DEF addresses Court. Recess 3:51 pm. On the Record 4:00 pm. Court issues sentence:
6 years total sentence, 2 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision - STAYED. Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Court Orders: 6 years probation and 360 days condition time in St Croix County Jail, DEF is to be remanded into the custody of the St Croix County Sheriff's office
- 70 days credit
- Huber for employment and treatment
- Court Costs: $253
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200; Apply Bond
- $2,000 Fine
- AODA
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- DEF is to not possess firearms
- No contact with Noah Christoff or any known users
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Complete MRT
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

Sentencing hearing on April 20, 2018 at 10:30 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Noah C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Not to possess weapons.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Kirk Anderson   DF:  Melissa Sue Heebink appeared.  Case called at 2:16 pm. Includes 15CF514, 16CF52, 17CF121, 17CF257, 17CF492 and 17CF619. ADA Minser recites agreement. Court questions. No objection from Atty Anderson. Court amends Count #2 in 15CF514 to 961.41(1m)(ei) without enhancer.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to amended Count #2 in 15CF514. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Atty Anderson questions Def. Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #2 in 15CF514. Court dismisses Count #3 in 15CF514, 16CF52, 17CF121, 17CF257, 17CF492 and 17CF619. Court orders PSI. Court amends bond on 15CF514. Remaing money on file to be refunded to payor. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2018 at 10:30 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF513 and 15CF514:
CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea with defendant  Noah Andrew Christoff appeared from jail. On 15CF514 Atty Daniel Chapman appears with DE Melissa Heebink who appears in custody. Case called at 3:26 p.m. State calls Investigator James Haefner to the stand. S/T James Haefner. Direct by ADA Minser. Witness identifies Mr. Christoff and Ms. Heebink in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification of both defendant's. Cross by Atty Andrea. Direct by Atty Chapman. Witness excused at 3:39 p.m. No further evidence or witnesses by either party. State requesting a bind over.  Atty Andrea gives argument. ADA Minser gives response. Atty Chapman gives argument. Court finds probable cause on both files and binds defendant's over for trial. Atty Chapman would like to argue bond on 15CF514. Mother is present in the courtroom and would be willing to co-sign. ADA Minser objects. Court will amend bond to $10,000 cash, conditions to remain the same on 15CF514. Bond will remain as is on 15CF513.  Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.

-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Noah C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Not to possess weapons.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Atty Chapman
